You wouldn't believe the difference one mile upstream!

In the US manufactures of PFAS chemicals have paid out almost ¬£1bn for poisoning drinking water.

In Australia several towns ordered not to drink tap water.

In Italy 350,000 residents are suing local companies for poisoning tap water.

Here in the UK?

https://t.co/y7sHZpSiwP

urls.title: PFAS poisoning: Why is so little known about the presence of ‚Äòforever chemicals‚Äô in UK drinking water?
urls.description: Toxic PFAS is in the blood of almost everyone in the world. It is a problem whose significance is understood in America, Australia and across Europe, but less so in the UK, where awareness of the chemicals and their devastating health impacts is unusually low.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Mastermind
entity.description: The long-running quiz show has as its distinct prop an ominous black chair, where contestants sit and face a series of challenging questions, interrogation-style. Four contestants begin the programme, and the questions are based on both a specialised subject of their choice and a random subject. After two rounds, and a tiebreaker if needed, the player with the most points wins.
